H0.text: Which semi-aquatic carnivorous mammal of the weasel family has only two living species: the American and the European. Otter

H1.text: Which semi-aquatic carnivorous mammal of the weasel family has only two living species: the American and the European. Ferret

H2.text: Which semi-aquatic carnivorous mammal of the weasel family has only two living species: the American and the European. Badger

H3.text: Which semi-aquatic carnivorous mammal of the weasel family has only two living species: the American and the European. Mink

A4.text: The 14 extant otter species are all semiaquatic, both freshwater and marine.

A5.text: Lutrinae is a branch of the Mustelidae family, which includes weasels, badgers, mink, and wolverines, among other animals.

A6.text: There are two extant species referred to as 'mink', the American mink and the European mink.

A7.text: Mink are semiaquatic, carnivorous mammals in the family Mustelidae, which includes weasels.
